thread.title: The 2017 Oscars Had A Shocking Twist Ending And The Internet Lost It
thread.title_full: The 2017 Oscars Had A Shocking Twist Ending And The Internet Lost It

author: Andrew Roberts
title: The 2017 Oscars Had A Shocking Twist Ending And The Internet Lost It
text:
Getty Image
Nobody is going to be able to tell you that they saw the ending of the 2017 Oscars coming . In what is possibly the most embarrassing moment in television history, Warren Beatty and Faye Dunaway ended up with the wrong envelope when presenting the award for Best Picture and ended up naming La La Land the winner. Once all the film’s producers and talent took the stage, the shock of the happened when it was revealed that Moonlight was the actual Best Picture Oscar winner . 
If you've never seen the ending of Bonnie and Clyde, they just reenacted it on live TV. #Oscars 
— Josh Gates (@joshuagates) February 27, 2017 

For an awards show that many thought was going to be predictable from the very start, it turned out to be the most unpredictable show it could’ve been. And with that, many people were quick with their reactions and plenty of jokes, reminding many of Steve Harvey’s Miss Universe flub from 2015 . It would seem he’s off the hook a bit, even if people are still going to make jokes. Most people were just shocked that the mistake happened in the first place: 

Wow, that was one of the craziest endings to an Emmy awards show ever! I've never seen a Grammys end quite like that. Unreal!! #Oscars 
— RyansAverageLife (@RyanAbe) February 27, 2017 
like…the SIMPLE FACT ALONE THAT MOONLIGHT ACTUALLY WON IS CRAZY. THAT’S AMAZING. FORGETTING EVERYTHING ELSE
— David Sims (@davidlsims) February 27, 2017 

Others used to offer a little criticism to the show itself: 
Now somebody go get the card that said "Best Actor Casey Affleck". #Oscars pic.twitter.com/Ifqg7EqsOD 
— W. Kamau Bell (@wkamaubell) February 27, 2017 
Reminder, the Moonlight speech could have been TWICE AS LONG had it not been for whatever the fuck happened.
— Akilah Hughes (@AkilahObviously) February 27, 2017 
At least that didn't happen the other way around? #Oscars 
— Summer Brennan (@summerbrennan) February 27, 2017 


And then there was the gang that decided to use the moment to make jokes and comments about the election: 
it's been a rough six months for nate silver pic.twitter.com/edLd41i0s3 
— aidan (very cold) ❄️ (@AerialShading) February 27, 2017 
And also Hillary Clinton is the president
— Nate Chinen (@natechinen) February 27, 2017 
Personally, I blame the millions of undocumented Academy voters they bussed to the polls.*
*Citation needed
— Ronan Farrow (@RonanFarrow) February 27, 2017 
Sorry for the confusion, Lalaland won the popular vote but Moonlight the electoral college. #Oscars 
— Benjamin Haddad (@benjaminhaddad) February 27, 2017 
Too soon? #oscars pic.twitter.com/8oyERpcRA8 
— People For Bernie (@People4Bernie) February 27, 2017 


Luckily there were a lot of other people willing to just have fun and do what the internet does best: make silly jokes in reaction to live events
I LOVE THE INTERNET #Oscars pic.twitter.com/1IDfFY69sf 
— Common White Girl (@girlposts) February 27, 2017 
And the Oscar for Best Picture goes to… #Oscars pic.twitter.com/MYjLmtJ9ZB 
— California Humor (@OWCalifornia) February 27, 2017 
La La Land: the Atlanta Falcons of the #Oscars .
— Robert Flores (@RoFlo) February 27, 2017 
Black America currently #Oscars pic.twitter.com/A2xWm0ukG3 
— Angry Gay Guy (@squiddy54) February 27, 2017 
WE DID IT pic.twitter.com/VHbpohn1dX 
— Bucky Isotope (@BuckyIsotope) February 27, 2017 
pic.twitter.com/FxGw8V4EvS 
— Ryan Cracknell (@tradercracks) February 27, 2017 


That's how you pull off a Dusty Finish. #Oscars #Kayfabe 
— WWE Creative Humor (@WWECreative_ish) February 27, 2017 
I blame Voldemort. #Oscars 
— Professor Snape (@_Snape_) February 27, 2017 
there will be a terrible Ryan Murphy series about tonight’s #Oscars 
— david ehrlich (@davidehrlich) February 27, 2017 
It tolls for thee. #Oscars pic.twitter.com/Jb3ysnAc59 
— Matt Ufford (@mattufford) February 27, 2017 
OH MY GOD HEY #OSCARS LOOK AT THE CARD AGAIN! pic.twitter.com/nXN7sZbgkX 
— Dave Lozo (@davelozo) February 27, 2017 
You know Steve Harvey is sitting at the house like… #Oscars pic.twitter.com/6PTTW9F2aL 
— Cory Aldridge (@aldridge32) February 27, 2017 

And at the end of it, when folks were ready to accept La La Land as the victor, something like this happened:
Just when you thought #Moonlight was dead pic.twitter.com/utubHcXyN9 
— UPROXX (@UPROXX) February 27, 2017 

It’s a beautiful thing.
